subsection_content:
According to the structure of the eye, the uvea consists of three parts: the iris, ciliary body and choroid. This is also where many blood vessels are located, including veins and arteries that carry blood to nourish the eyes.
Peritonitis occurs in all ages
Uveitis is inflammation anywhere in the pigmented layer inside the eye (uvea). The disease can affect the lens, retina, and optic nerves. (first)

viem mang bo dao.json. What is uveitis?
According to the structure of the eye, the uvea consists of three parts: the iris, ciliary body and choroid. This is also where many blood vessels are located, including veins and arteries that carry blood to nourish the eyes.
Peritonitis occurs in all ages
Uveitis is inflammation anywhere in the pigmented layer inside the eye (uvea). The disease can affect the lens, retina, and optic nerves. (first)
